page.title: 02Footpaths
page.content: Linking up with the wide network of footpaths in the village of Nether Wallop are the straight grass tracks between hedges flanked by fields. No doubt these "Green Lanes" were once used by drovers from pasture to pasture. The tracks nowadays are still much in use by farmers with tractors for access to their fields. But they are also very frequently enjoyed by numbers of people for recreational purposes: riding, walking, and bird-watching. So one must conclude that they are used by a wider section of the population than before. In the N.W. corner tracks and paths are closed to the public; they are on W.D.(Porton) land accessible at specified times Paths have been lost by farmers not reinstating them, others diverted when original purpose has ceased.
